definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)
One world - one dream, motto of 2008 Beijing Olympic games
pinyin: tong2 yi1 ge4 shi4 jie4 , tong2 yi1 ge4 meng4 xiang3
containing_words.word: 同一个世界，同一个梦想

sentences.english: It is a dream deeply rooted in the American dream.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个深植于美国梦的梦想。

sentences.english: He was very open about his inspiration and his plans for his career.
sentences.chinese: 对于他的梦想和职业生涯计划，韩庚是很公开的。

sentences.english: My dream is to work full-time at home.
sentences.chinese: 我的梦想是全职在家里。

sentences.english: So long as opens the mouth to sing, lengthens until the dream, hears the echo to be resonant.
sentences.chinese: 只要开口唱，直到梦想延长，听到回音多嘹亮。

sentences.english: Chang'e 1 Lunar orbiter will achieve the ancient dream of the Chinese.
sentences.chinese: “嫦娥1号”将完成的，是中国人的一个古老的梦想。

sentences.english: Indeed it was giraffe and deer that have woven the new dreamtime for all to partake in.
sentences.chinese: 的确，正是长颈鹿与鹿为所有物种编织了这一新梦想。

sentences.english: It is the dreamthat wakes within us all.
sentences.chinese: 是这样的梦想将我们所有人唤醒。

sentences.english: I want to go there, can you take with me?
sentences.chinese: 仅这个梦想，我花尽了心思。

sentences.english: For if dreams go. Life is a barren field. Frozenwith snow.
sentences.chinese: 如果梦想消失了，生活就变成了积满冰雪的不毛之地。

sentences.english: Here Xuan developed Liezi dream of the same theory.
sentences.chinese: 这里周宣发展了列子的梦想同一的理论。

sentences.english: Many explorers hoped to discover Eldorado, the fabled City of Gold.
sentences.chinese: 冒险家都梦想找到埃尔多拉多这个传说中的黄金之城。

sentences.english: I couldn't believe I was speaking to the player I grew up idolising.
sentences.chinese: 我不敢相信我和梦想中的偶像在交谈。

sentences.english: The Chinese dream is pre-eminence in Asia, and this goes to the heart of that dream.
sentences.chinese: 中国的梦想是称雄亚洲，而该计划处于中国梦的核心。

sentences.english: Our dream is to change this bad image.
sentences.chinese: 我们的梦想是扭转这种不良印象。

sentences.english: To get where we have always dreamed of going, we must rise to the challenge.
sentences.chinese: 为实现梦想，我们必须挺身面对挑战。

sentences.english: We harbour ambitions of putting together a group for the Mendelssohn Octet.
sentences.chinese: 我们还梦想着再找来些人一起演奏门德尔松的八重奏。

definition: dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
to yearn for/to look forward to
to long for/to look forward to/longing/vision for the future
(one's) original intention, aspiration etc/(Buddhism) "beginner's mind" (i.e. having an attitude of openness when studying a subject just as a beginner in that subject would)
